Job Location - Vadodara, Gujarat

CTC - Best in Industry

Experience - 0-1 years (Freshers can apply)

Job Role & Responsibility -
 Develop AI / ML solutions using data science and advanced analytics for the most complex problems. Thus this role to lead the solution build for the biggest impact projects / problems
 Help maintain data required for advanced analytics as cost effectively as possible and also supporting the drive to clean and keep this data clean.
 Support the other analyst with advanced analytics and thus in their own data science projects
 Run regular training in data science to help improve capability of the internal resources learning to be data scientists.

 Using data mining to extract information from data. sets and identify correlations and patterns
 Organising and transforming information into comprehensible structures by monitoring data quality and removing corrupt data.
 Performing statistical analysis of data and visualise it in easy-to-understand formats, such as diagrams and graphs.
 Preparing reports and presenting these to management or clients.

Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS "big data" technologies

 University Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or Related technical field

Experience
 0-1 years of experience and highly skilled coder in Python or any other contemporary programming language e.g. Java, C++.
 Knowledge of SQL programming and work experience in relational databases will be an added advantage.

job details:
Company Description

Data Unveil is a specialized business consulting firm based in Hyderabad. We combine deep subject matter knowledge with technical expertise to help transform how pharmaceutical brands engage with patients and healthcare providers. Our best-in-class approach provides powerful insights to brand and patient services leaders.

Job Description:

As an Entry-Level Data Analytics Associate, you will have the opportunity to kickstart your career in the exciting field of data analytics. You will work alongside experienced professionals on challenging projects, gaining hands-on experience with cutting-edge technologies and methodologies. This role is perfect for recent graduates or individuals with limited professional experience who are passionate about data analytics and eager to learn and grow in a dynamic environment.

Key Responsibilities:
 Assist in collecting, cleaning, and preprocessing data from various sources for analysis.
 Conduct exploratory data analysis to. identify patterns, trends, and insights.
 Support the development and implementation of statistical models and machine learning algorithms.
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and deliver actionable insights.
 Create data visualizations and dashboards to communicate findings to stakeholders effectively.
 Contribute to the documentation and presentation of analytical results clearly and concisely.
 Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in data analytics and related technologies.

Qualifications:
 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or a related field from a reputable college or university.
 A strong academic record with a good GPA is a must.
 Passion for working with data and solving complex problems.
 Basic understanding of programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
 Familiarity with data visualization tools.
 Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
 Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
 Ability to work well both independently and as part of a team.

At Data Unveil, we are committed to investing in talent and providing opportunities for professional development. As an Entry-Level Data Analytics Associate, you will receive mentorship from experienced professionals and have the chance to grow and advance in your career,

job details:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future  If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

About This Program

Objective: To apply rich knowledge and research mindset and empower them to build rewarding and satisfying careers in the fields of transport and infrastructure.

Structure: Paid program of nine-month duration

Eligibility: PhD Scholars registered with any university in India or abroad in a relevant academic discipline, currently employed or doing projects in specifically identified areas (Currently pursuing PhD).

Place of Work: Bangalore

About The Function

Electro-mobility is one of the focus areas within Volvo Group, which is at the forefront of sustainable transport solutions for tomorrow. Also, we are providing world-class solutions for electro-mobility systems and. delivering customer values for Volvo business units such as trucks, buses, construction equipment and marine applications.

We at EMOB Data Analytics team focus on data driven development and look to create opportunities for services.

You will have close cross-functional collaboration with colleagues from different parts of Technology Organization. You along with the team will be responsible for understanding customer usage and performance of our products and for providing solutions throughout the entire product life cycle.

Who are you 

We believe that to be successful in the position, you are a team player, have strong understanding in Data Science and proficient in Electro-mobility systems.

You have great appetite for learning and adding value, with high level ownership.

You are highly skilled in tools like Power BI, SQL and Python.

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

Who We Are And What We Believe In

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join Volvo Group. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the groups leading brands and entities.

Group Trucks Technology are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, youll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation,
skills: Data Science,Power BI,SQL,Python,Electromobility systems

Our innovative blend of remote work culture and cutting-edge AI technology positions us as leaders in the recruitment landscape, providing a gateway to unlock your career aspirations. In partnership with a prestigious Management Consulting firm in Germany, we're seeking ambitious talents ready to redefine the landscape of data analysis.

Role Overview:

Tailored for individuals passionate about data analysis and equipped with problem-solving skills, this internship offers an immersive introduction to the field. Under the guidance of industry experts, you'll tackle diverse data analysis projects, exploring concepts like data visualization, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and data mining. Expect hands-on experience in uncovering insights and informing decisions, all from the comfort of your own space.

Opportunity Snapshot:
 Location: Fully Remote
 Schedule. Flexible Internship

Who We're Searching For:
 Aspiring data analysts keen on unraveling complex datasets and extracting meaningful insights
 Analytical thinkers adept at translating data into actionable recommendations
 Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team settings
 Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, analytical environments
 Enthusiastic learners committed to honing their skills in data analysis
 Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL) highly valued
 Familiarity with statistical techniques, data visualization, and database management advantageous

Your Contribution:
 Contribute to data collection, cleaning, and analysis processes
 Collaborate with the data analysis team to develop analytical models and insights
 Aid in interpreting data trends and patterns to inform strategic decision-making
 Bring fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to tackle data challenges
 Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in data analysis
 Assist in documenting and presenting analysis results and recommendations

Why Choose This Path 

Winged Recruitment serves as your catalyst for career growth, aligning you with roles promising substantial advancement in data analysis. This internship provides an exceptional platform for learning and establishing your presence in the data analysis industry, mentored by top-tier management consulting experts in Germany.

Application Note:

Applying through Winged Recruitment grants access to an extraordinary opportunity with our esteemed client. Committed to GDPR compliance, we handle your information with the utmost respect for privacy and security. By submitting your application, you consent to sharing your resume with our client for the internship selection process.

Embark on your data analysis journey with this unparalleled internship. Apply now and pave the way for your future in data analysis,
skills: Python,R,SQL,Data Visualization,Database Management,Statistical Techniques

job details:
Looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst Intern to join our team. This internship opportunity will provide hands-on experience in analyzing data, generating insights, and supporting various data-driven initiatives within the company. The ideal candidate should have a passion for working with data, strong analytical skills, and the ability to communicate findings effectively.

Responsibilities
 Data Collection and Cleaning:
 Assist in collecting, cleaning, and organizing data from various sources
 Utilize tools and techniques to ensure data accuracy and integrity
 Data Analysis:
 Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns, trends, and insights
 Develop and implement analytical models to extract actionable insights from large datasets
 Use statistical methods to interpret data and draw conclusions
 Visualization and Reporting:
 Create visualizations and dashboards to present findings in a clear and concise manner
 Prepare reports and presentations. for internal stakeholders
 Data Interpretation and Recommendations:
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and objectives
 Interpret data analysis results to provide actionable recommendations for decision-making
 Continuously monitor key metrics and provide insights to drive business performance
 Research and Innovation:
 Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analysis
 Contribute ideas for process improvement and innovation in data analytics methodologies

Mandatory Requirements
 Currently pursuing a Diploma or Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field
 Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
 Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, or similar
 Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib

Preferred Requirements

Previous internship or academic projects related to data analysis or machine learning

Qualities
 Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders
 Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment
 Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies in data analytics

Benefits
 Hands-on experience in a dynamic and collaborative work environment.
 Opportunity to work closely with experienced professionals in the field of data analytics.
 Exposure to real-world projects and challenges that contribute to personal and professional growth.
 Competitive compensation package or stipend.

Duration: 3 months, 6 months

Location: Onsite, Remote, Hybrid,

job details:
The Data Analyst will join the JLL Research team in JBS to contribute to all aspects of the Research data platform for property data collected and analyzed. The Data Analyst will build upon and continue to elevate a best-in-class research program that differentiates JLL and drives a competitive advantage in the marketplace through market expertise, analysis and insight. The Data Analyst will be responsible for achieving data excellence to enhance our offerings in the areas of business intelligence, data visualization, and graphical output.

Duties & responsibilities

Collect, audit and input data into JLL's proprietary database of Data centre real estate properties following standard operating procedures Gain an understanding of data centres and real estate data concepts and relationships and use that knowledge to ensure data quality Take direction from onshore colleagues on activity prioritization and data quality achievement Implement and share best practice standards for the region. and the Americas Research Group Refine processes and make recommendations for efficiency gains Gain expertise in the use of our technology tools Monitor data completeness to achieve data validation and audit levels Train as needed internal teams to demonstrate our data excellence objectives and the tools and processes to achieve them Leverage visualization tools to identify strengths and weaknesses in our data sets and execute remediation plans

Key skills

Background in the Data centre industry, power sector or cloud services preferred Engineering degree or equivalent years of experience in data centres/IT hardware firms preferred Up to one year in Data centres, commercial real estate research, economic and demographic analysis or closely related field preferred (Data Analyst) Additional technological skills such as Map IT or any other mapping tools will be an advantage Working knowledge of dashboards, spreadsheets High attention to detail Strong organisational, data collection, analysis, validation and auditing skills Ability to multi-task, succeed under pressure and effectively manage time and workload Proactive and strategic thinking and ability to align research data with the business and innovate process efficiency Command of requisite technology including Excel and Word High-level analytical skills and problem-solving ability and written and oral communication skills (English language proficiency) Comfort utilizing data visualization tools Motivated and self-starting with a desire to succeed and contribute to the success of a team A desire to work within a diverse, collaborative, and driven professional environment

Employee specification

B.E (any stream), B.com,

job details:
About Colmore

You will be joining the worlds leading data and insights provider for the alternative assets market. We empower the global financial community with critical information and leading analytics solutions to help them make faster and smarter investment decisions, and to make them with confidence. A forward-thinking company, we lead our industry through innovation. We trust in the power of data, and we use it to increase transparency in alternatives. We believe that access to information leads to more investment in the ideas and infrastructure that build strong communities.

As an Analyst within the FAIR team, you will be part of a high impact team spanning 3 continents whos focused on delivering exceptional client service. Reporting into the Head of FAIR, you will be responsible for extracting key financial data and generating reports for our global client base.

Roles and Responsibilities:
 Interpret, extract and analyze relevant financial and qualitative information. from financial statements, capital account statements, ILPA templates, and other financial documents
 Produce detailed draft reports on costs incurred by clients in alternative investments
 Escalate relevant issues and anomalies identified during due diligence to senior staff accordingly  Work closely and maintain optimal cooperation with the team, ensuring projects stay on-track and can be delivered to clients within required timelines
 Develop excellent understanding of the teams workflows, methodologies, reporting and client deliverables within the first 6 months

Key requirement for this role:
 Detailed-orientated individual who works well independently on systematic projects
 Expertise in comprehending financial statements, notes to the financial statements, capital account statements, and other information commonly provided by GPs
 Strong communication skills, including proactively asking questions and flagging roadblocks to other team members
 Self-motivated to meet internal KPIs, with the knowledge that consistently exceeding them can lead to career progression
 Meticulous when it comes to applying consistent methodologies when extracting data and creating reports
 Ability to work accurately under pressure and meet team and client deadlines
 Basic understanding of Microsoft Excel (being able to use formulas such as SUM, SUMIF, VLOOKUP, etc.)
 1-2 years experience in a finance or accounting role
 Prior experience working with UK or US based teams preferred
 Bachelors degree in finance or accounting preferred, but not required

Our culture and values are:
 Be Customer obsessed
 We exist for our customers. We listen to them and understand their challenges. We design best-in-class data solutions for their success.
 Act with integrity
 We build trust through honesty and transparency. Were committed to doing the right thing for our customers, our company, and each other.
 Own your success
 Were a high-performance team. We challenge and champion each other in our pursuit of excellence. We never stop learning and strive to become experts in our fields
 Think forward
 We lead the industry through innovation. We foster collaboration and creativity to solve our clients next challenge and give them a competitive advantage.
 Make an impact
 We drive positive change as individuals, and as a company. Were passionate about creating a better tomorrow for our industry and our communities,
skills: Financial Analysis,Data Extraction,Report Generation,Client Service,Microsoft Excel,Financial Statements Interpretation

job details:
Job overview

A Data analyst will collect, store, analyze, match & map data between two large sets of databases. The mapping of data needs to happen with attention and exceptional quality and accuracy. The job involves preparing documentation for mapping and processes.

Data Analyst Duties and Responsibilities

 Extracting data from primary and secondary sources and removing corrupted data.

 Verifying data accuracy, using statistical tools to map and creating data systems and reports for management.

 Ensuring that the data is accurate and high-quality.

 Developing and managing data systems and databases.

 Collaborating with various stakeholders to develop and streamline data governance strategies.

Desired profile

1. 1 to 3 years of working with data mapping, data cleansing, data mining, data management.

2. Associates or other Degrees: Computer and Information Systems Managers, Computer Programmer or Computer Systems Analyst.

3. Java, Java Script and XML, PHP/Python, my. SQL, Advance Excel, VLOOKUP, is a plus

4. Some experience with XML, XSD, fixed Length and CSV comma separated value files, required.

5. Strong problem-solving skills, the ability to work independently, and great communication skills are required.

6. Excel, Outlook, Access and Windows experience required.

7. Must be able to work in a team environment.

8. Ability to multi-task several projects to accomplish team goals required.

9. Ability to learn quickly,

job details:
Job Title
Data Analyst (Hybrid)
Job Description
For more than 80 years, Kaplan has been a trailblazer in education and professional advancement. We are a global company at the intersection of education and technology, focused on collaboration, innovation, and creativity to deliver a best in class educational experience and make Kaplan a great place to work.
Our offices in India opened in Bengaluru in 2018. Since then, our team has fueled growth and innovation across the organization, impacting students worldwide. We are eager to grow and expand with skilled professionals like you who use their talent to build solutions, enable effective learning, and improve students lives.
The future of education is here and we are eager to work alongside those who want to make a positive impact and inspire change in the world around them.
The Data Analyst role is an integral part of the Kaplan Analytics Team, which comprises Data Scientists, BI developers, Data Engineers, and Data Analysts. This. cohesive team is dedicated to providing robust data infrastructure and delivering data-driven solutions to drive key business initiatives. As a Data Analyst within this framework, collaboration with the Business Team is paramount. It involves closely partnering with business stakeholders to understand and tackle critical business challenges effectively.
Primary/Key Responsibilities
 Problem Solving with Data-Driven Solutions: Utilize data analysis techniques to identify and address business challenges effectively, leveraging insights derived from data to propose and implement strategic solutions.
 Data Management and Quality Assurance: Conduct data querying, cleansing, manipulation, and other tasks to ensure timely and high-quality delivery of data, maintaining data integrity and accuracy throughout the analytical process.
 Presentation and Visualization Development: Develop presentations, visualizations, and metrics to address stakeholders" inquiries, providing clear and insightful representations of data-driven findings to support informed decision-making.
 Continuous Learning and Technological Advancement: Stay abreast of the latest tools and technologies in data analysis, continuously learning and improving skills to remain up-to-date with industry advancements and enhance analytical capabilities.
 Collaborative Cross-Functional Teamwork: Engage in cross-functional collaboration within multidisciplinary teams, working closely with technical and business functional units to ensure alignment of objectives, foster effective communication, and drive collective success.
 Business Acumen and Strategic Contribution: Proactively engage in comprehending business operations, identifying pertinent data sources, and leveraging insights to propose innovative, data-driven solutions that address key business challenges and drive strategic initiatives.
 Hybrid Schedule: 3 days remote / 2 days in office
 30-day notification period preferred

Minimum Qualifications
 Bachelors or Above in Statistics/Mathematics, Engineering, Or Business Or any other equivalent degree.
 Minimum 2 years of hands-on experience with SQL for data querying and management.
 Minimum 2 years of experience with R or Python for data analysis and automation.
 Minimum 2 years of experience with Tableau or similar tools for creating impactful visualizations.
 Minimum 4 years of experience in data analytics within commercial settings, spanning domains like Marketing, Operations, or Product Management.
 Strong knowledge of basic and fundamental statistics.
 Strong problem solving skills.
 Strong communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications
 Interpersonal Skill
 Executive Reporting
 Stakeholder management

Bangalore, KA, India

Employee

 Implement digital tools, programs, and processes for use by global user community within Global Development
 Mentor and coach in a domain of their expertise

 Develop scalable and robust code in R or Python
 Write code that is high. quality, well detailed, efficient and is easy to maintain
 Drive testing and deployment of software solutions, including implementing of automated testing to ensure solution quality
 Improve operational efficiency by developing automation tools and scripts (e.g. CI/CD automation)
 Provide ongoing solutions support, incl. incident and problem management (L2+), root cause analysis, and request fulfilment
 Provide technical expertise in process, system, and tool improvement initiatives
 Ensure compliance with regulatory, security and other audit requirements at all times
 Conducts requirements collecting and analysis
 Share expertise to support the clinical data delivery and analysis teams and Clinical Research Organizations (CROs) by coordinating trainings, Question and Answers sessions, and providing direct support when needed

QualificationsEducation:
 A minimum of a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Science, or related field is required.

Experience and Skills:Required:
 At least 4 years of meaningful experience in software development and engineering, clinical development or data science field
 High proficiency in Python or R (including R-Shiny).
 Knowledgeable in modern software design patterns and architectural principles
 Must have superb communication, interpersonal, and written skills
 Must be able to work independantly and without supervision

Preferred:
 Knowledge of Data Management or/and Statistical Computing platforms.
 Experience with data wrangling, data processing and data engineering techniques on large datasets.
 Must have a Global Business demeanor and be able to support system and process improvements with operational excellence.
 Must possess ability to think analytically, be quality results oriented and customer focused.
 Technical expertise, preferably in pharmaceutical or a regulated industry, with an experience gained through working with diverse and sophisticated data integration, warehousing and ingestion.

Other:

job details:
Role/Job Title: Data Analyst

Function/Department: Data & Analytics

Job Purpose:

The Data Analyst role identifies business needs and builds analytical tools and methods. Will also develop test strategies and will Ensure delivery outcomes for specific business asks on Data Analytics

Job & Responsibilities:
 Identify and scope business requirements and priorities through rigorous information gathering and analysis as well as clarification of the solutions, initiatives and programmes to enable effective delivery.
 Monitor and integrate emerging technology trends and developments, structured data gathering for the identification of new and emerging technological products, services and techniques.
 Specify and create data structures, including the setting of various parameters that can be modified to suit different structured and unstructured data requirements, the design of data flow, as well as the development of mechanisms for maintenance, storage and retrieval of data based on. the business requirements.
 Develop and implement guidelines, processes and norms across the organization for the handling of data at various stages in its lifecycle as well as the provision of advice on proper data handling and resolution of data breaches in a range of complex, ambiguous or multi-faceted contexts
Design solution blueprints and structures to guide the development of tech solutions to meet current and future business needs.
 Manage stakeholder expectations and needs by aligning those with requirements and objectives of the organization.
 Develop a test strategy and systematic test procedures to verify and ensure that solution meets its design specifications as well as the performance, load and volume levels set out.
 Identify and evaluate digitization and innovative business opportunities provided by new advancements in data & analytics to establish new services or businesses to bridge the physical and digital worlds.
 Develop, select and apply analytical tools and advanced computational methods to enable systems to learn, improve, adapt and produce desired outcomes or tasks

Key Success Metrics:
 Development analytical tools and deployment
 Business use cases

Graduation: Bachelors in engineering / technology / Maths / Commerce / Arts / Science / Biology / Business / Computers / Management

job details:
Description:

Join GlobalLogic, to be a valid part of the team working on a huge software project for the world-class company providing M2M / IoT 4G/5G modules e.g. to the automotive, healthcare and logistics industries. Through our engagement, we contribute to our customer in developing the end-user modules firmware, implementing new features, maintaining compatibility with the newest telecommunication and industry standards, as well as performing analysis and estimations of the customer requirements.

Requirements:

Must Have skills

Working experience in product data analytics area

Excellent knowledge of A/B testing. Should be able to plan & support tests. Should be able to analyse results and prepare dashboards

Dashboarding / Visualization Skills (Good to have Tableau or any other tool)

SQL knowledge. Person should be able understand and write basic queries

Strong communication

Collecting and interpreting data, Crunching data, Identifying trends and patterns.

Reporting. findings to management, dashboarding,

HImplementing data analysis, strategies, optimizing data quality and efficiency.

Job Responsibilities:

The ideal candidate for this role must possess a strong set of skills and experience in product data analytics. Key responsibilities include planning and supporting A/B tests, analyzing results, and preparing insightful dashboards. Proficiency in SQL is essential for understanding and writing basic queries. Strong communication skills are necessary for effectively reporting findings to management. Additionally, the candidate should excel in collecting, interpreting, and crunching data, identifying trends and patterns, and implementing data analysis strategies to optimize data quality and efficiency. Good to have experience with dashboarding and visualization tools like Tableau.

What We Offer

Exciting Projects: We focus on industries like High-Tech, communication, media, healthcare, retail and telecom. Our customer list is full of fantastic global brands and leaders who love what we build for them.

Collaborative Environment: You Can expand your skills by collaborating with a diverse team of highly talented people in an open, laidback environment  or even abroad in one of our global centers or client facilities!

Work-Life Balance: GlobalLogic prioritizes work-life balance, which is why we offer flexible work schedules, opportunities to work from home, and paid time off and holidays.

Professional Development: Our dedicated Learning & Development team regularly organizes Communication skills training(GL Vantage, Toast Master),Stress Management program, professional certifications, and technical and soft skill trainings.

Excellent Benefits: We provide our employees with competitive salaries, family medical insurance, Group Term Life Insurance, Group Personal Accident Insurance , NPS(National Pension Scheme ), Periodic health awareness program, extended maternity leave, annual performance bonuses, and referral bonuses.

Fun Perks: We want you to love where you work, which is why we host sports events, cultural activities, offer food on subsidies rates, Corporate parties. Our vibrant offices also include dedicated GL Zones, rooftop decks and GL Club where you can drink coffee or tea with your colleagues over a game of table and offer discounts for popular stores and restaurants!

About GlobalLogic GlobalLogic is a leader in digital engineering. We help brands across the globe design and build innovative products, platforms, and digital experiences for the modern world. By integrating experience design, complex engineering, and data expertisewe help our clients imagine whats possible, and accelerate their transition into tomorrows digital businesses. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, GlobalLogic operates design studios and engineering centers around the world, extending our deep expertise to customers in the automotive, communications, financial services, healthcare and life sciences, manufacturing, media and entertainment, semiconductor, and technology industries. GlobalLogic is a Hitachi Group Company operating under Hitachi, Ltd. (TSE: 6501) which contributes to a sustainable society with a higher quality of life by driving innovation through data and technology as the Social Innovation Business,

Our client is a leading provider of data solutions, research content services and tech services.

Position Overview:

We are seeking a talented Data Analyst with expertise in SQL, Python, Power BI and Tableau to support our asset management operations. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, a solid understanding of financial markets, and the ability to leverage data to drive strategic decision-making. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and collaborate with cross-functional teams in the financial services, investment banking, fintech and asset management sectors.

job details:
As a Data Analytics Trainer, you will be responsible for designing and delivering training programs focused on data analytics, covering topics such as data visualization, statistical analysis, and data interpretation. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in data analytics, a proficiency in relevant tools and technologies, and a passion for teaching. Your role will be pivotal in equipping participants with the skills needed to excel in the field of data analytics.

Key Responsibilities:
 Curriculum Development:
 Design and develop comprehensive training materials, curriculum, and hands-on exercises for data analytics.
 Stay updated with the latest tools, techniques, and trends in the data analytics field.
 Classroom Instruction:
 Conduct engaging and interactive training sessions for diverse groups of learners, ensuring a positive and effective learning experience.
 Cover topics such as data exploration, statistical analysis, machine learning, and data. visualization.
 Practical Workshops:
 Organize and facilitate practical workshops, allowing participants to apply data analytics concepts to real-world scenarios.
 Provide guidance on using analytics tools and interpreting results.
 Tool Proficiency:
 Instruct participants on the use of popular data analytics tools such as Python, R, SQL, and visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
 Conduct hands-on sessions to familiarize participants with these tools.
 Case Studies:
 Present and analyze real-world case studies, demonstrating the application of data analytics in solving business problems.
 Assessment and Feedback:
 Develop and administer assessments to evaluate participants" understanding and proficiency in data analytics concepts.
 Provide constructive feedback and support to help participants enhance their analytical skills.
 Stay Updated:
 Stay abreast of emerging trends and technologies in the data analytics field.
 Continuously update training materials to reflect industry best practices.
 Collaboration:

job details:
Company Overview:

Convergint is an internationally renowned systems integration company dedicated to achieving exceptional outcomes for our clients through unparalleled service excellence. At Convergint, our utmost commitment lies in service excellence across all facets: serving our customers, supporting our colleagues, and contributing to our communities.

Position Overview:

We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Data Analyst specializing in Statistics to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in statistical analysis techniques, data manipulation, and visualization. They will play a crucial role in extracting insights from complex datasets to inform decision-making processes within the organization.

Key Responsibilities:
 Data Collection and Cleaning:

Collect, clean, and preprocess large datasets from various sources (Big Data sources like Azure, SQL Server, spreadsheets etc.,) to ensure data integrity and reliability. Implement data quality. checks and develop strategies for data cleansing and validation.
 Statistical Analysis:

Apply advanced statistical methods to analyze data and extract meaningful insights. Conduct hypothesis testing, regression analysis, time series analysis, and other statistical techniques to address business questions and solve problems.
 Data Visualization:

Create clear and concise visualizations (e.g., charts, graphs, dashboards) to communicate analytical findings and trends effectively. Utilize tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib to visualize data and present results to stakeholders.
 Predictive Modeling:

Develop predictive models using machine learning algorithms to forecast trends, identify patterns and optimize business processes. Evaluate model performance and refine algorithms to improve accuracy and efficiency.
 Reporting and Presentation:

Prepare comprehensive reports and presentations summarizing analytical findings and recommendations for key stakeholders. Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner to both technical and non-technical audiences.
 Collaboration and Teamwork:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams including data engineers, business analysts, and decision-makers to understand business requirements and provide analytical support. Contribute to a culture of continuous learning and knowledge sharing within the team.

Qualifications:
 Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
 Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a focus on statistical analysis and modeling.
 Proficiency in statistical programming languages such as R or Python, as well as SQL for data manipulation and extraction.
 Strong understanding of statistical concepts and methodologies, including hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and experimental design.
 Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, matplotlib etc.,
 Familiarity with machine learning techniques and frameworks is a plus.
 Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.

Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas to diverse audiences.

Thanks & Regards

HR Dept,
skills: Statistical Analysis,Data Manipulation,Data Visualization,Predictive Modeling,Machine Learning,Data Cleansing,Hypothesis Testing,Regression Analysis,Time Series Analysis,Statistical Programming,SQL,Tableau,Power BI,Matplotlib

Who are we looking for 

We are seeking a Business and Data Analyst who will play a crucial role in enhancing our operational efficiencies and market positioning through insightful analysis and strategic data interpretation.

The analyst will be responsible for collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support business decisions, optimize operations, and identify growth opportunities.

What will you do 
 Data Management and Analysis: Collect, integrate, and analyze data from various sources, including shipping operations, customer feedback, market trends, and financial reports. Utilize statistical tools and models to uncover patterns and insights.
 Reporting and Visualization: Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights to business stakeholders. Present complex data in a comprehensible and visually appealing manner.
 Strategic Support: Support strategic planning efforts by providing data-driven insights and forecasts. Participate in the. development of business strategies by identifying opportunities for growth and efficiency improvements.

job details:
Analytics Analyst

Location: Bangalore

Division: Ipsos Healthcare

Ipsos is one of the world's largest research companies and currently the only one primarily managed by researchers, ranking as a #1 full-service research organization for four consecutive years. With over 75 different data-driven solutions, and presence in 90 markets, Ipsos brings together research, implementation, methodological, and subject-matter experts from around the world, combining thematic and technical experts to deliver top-quality research and insights. Simply speaking, we help the biggest companies solve some of their biggest problems, serving more than 5,000 clients across the globe by providing research, data, and insights on their target markets. And we're proud to share we've received our Great Place to Work Certification for 2022!

About Healthcare:

The Healthcare Service Line works with Pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device manufacturers and technology companies throughout the project lifecycle. from early-stage strategy, to launch of a new product, to product optimization. In addition to custom research, the healthcare Service Line also works on therapeutic centers of expertise in Oncology, Autoimmune, Virology and more.

As an Analytics Analyst, you will:
 Work closely with team members on design and execution of large-scale modeling efforts, including programming, statistical analysis, and reporting.
 Collaborate on programming new data science products by translating needs identified with clients into analytic frameworks that can be developed into polished applications.
 Build, maintain and enhance codebases underlying key applications.
 Support other marketing science analyses for clients as required.
Communicate with and provide consulting for internal teams and external clients on data models, analysis findings, process efficiency, and marketing science best practices.
 Requirements:
 Proficiency in advanced Python and/or R programming, including the ability to produce and maintain reusable and modular codebases.
 Bachelors degree
 Comfortable working in a highly collaborative, consensus-oriented environment.
 Experience in analytics, extracting and surfacing value from quantitative data.
Strong eye for detail, ability to communicate scientific concepts both in written form and verbally, and excellent time-management skills.
 Pluses:
 Advanced degree (M.S., Ph.D.) is preferred, but by no means required.
 Strong knowledge of underlying mathematical foundations of statistics and machine learning
 Experience with multiple modern techniques and algorithms in machine learning and statistical computing such as regression, clustering/segmentation, time-series analysis, recommender systems, predictive analytics, network analysis, Monte Carlo, agent-based models, Bayesian modeling, data fusion, drivers analysis, neural networks, and genetic algorithms.
 Working knowledge of SQL
 Prior success designing and deploying machine learning solutions in large-scale production environments.
 Experience with collaboration tools (e.g. Atlassian suite) and version control systems (e.g. Git).
 Large dataset manipulation. Experience in distributed storage and computing.
 Experience with JavaScript, esp. visualization libraries (e.g. d3.js).
 Experience creating and deploying web applications.
 Experience with Linux server and system administration.
 Experience in the field of Market Research,

address given questions.

trends and associated policy-related opportunities, challenges and priorities.

job details:
Company Description

TestGrid.io is a leading provider of end-to-end automation cloud and on-premise testing solutions. With an emphasis on simplifying the testing process, TestGrid's innovative AI-powered technology allows organizations to achieve significant time and cost savings while accelerating their go-to-market strategies.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with experience in AI to join our team. The ideal candidate will leverage both traditional data analysis and modern AI techniques to drive insights and inform business decisions. This role involves working with large datasets to uncover trends, predict outcomes, and optimize processes.

Key Responsibilities:
 Collect, process, and clean data from various sources to prepare it for analysis.
 Utilize statistical methods and machine learning algorithms to analyze data and generate predictive models.
 Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their questions and provide data-backed answers.
 Develop and maintain. dashboards and reports to visualize data insights and trends.
 Implement AI and machine learning tools to automate data analysis tasks where appropriate.
 Stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in data science and artificial intelligence.
 Communicate findings and insights to both technical and non-technical team members to inform business strategies.
 Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to improve data collection and analysis processes.
 Qualifications:
 Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
 2+ years of experience in data analysis, with a demonstrated interest or experience in AI and machine learning.
 Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., SQL, Python, R, Tableau, Power BI).
 Experience with machine learning libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) is preferred.
 Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
 Excellent problem-solving skills and creativity in developing new analytical techniques.
 Ability to work effectively in a team and communicate complex ideas clearly.
 A passion for continuous learning and professional development in the fields of data analysis and artificial intelligence.
Desired Skills:
 Experience with cloud computing services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) for data analysis.
 Familiarity with big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark) is a plus.
 Knowledge of or experience with natural language processing (NLP) or computer vision,

job details:
Our Partner, a Our Partner company which was founded on one idea - to empower those who invest in private markets. Private investments that are, well, a little less private and a little more open. With customers at the centre of our decision making, we are building industry-defining products and services for the fintech era, designed to give investors control, clarity, and confidence.

We operate from four offices located in the US and UK with an employee count of 200+ professionals. As an established Fintech company, we are setting up FAIR Data Analyst operations in Bangalore and we are seeking creative and proactive professionals to help us define the future of our technology.

As a FAIR Data Analyst within the FAIR/ Investor Insight team, you will be part of a high impact team focused on delivering exceptional customer service. Reporting into a FAIR Client Manager/ Sr.Associate, you will be responsible for providing data extraction support to the FAIR Team in the context of. analysing financial statements, capital account statements, quarterly reports, ILPA templates, and other documents provided to Our Partner from GPs.

Roles and Responsibilities:
 Should be able to extract key expense and fee data from financial statements, notes to the financial statements, capital account statements, quarterly reports, and ILPA templates into the custom FAIR platform.
 Make sure that the FAIR team is provided with key data on a timely basis in order to meet Client deadlines.
 Work with the Client Support team in order to obtain and maintain the necessary documents to support the data extraction.
 Flag key footnotes or strange/ unusual items to the FAIR team for further investigation.
 Liaise directly with GPs to obtain key information for the FAIR team.
 Work closely with the FAIR team to make sure projects stay on-track and can be delivered to clients on a timely basis
 Understand how work is transferred through the team and ultimately to clients.
 Flag potential setbacks and bottlenecks to the FAIR Client Manager quickly and effectively.

Key requirement for this role:
 2+ years experience in a data processing or finance/accounting role is preferred.
 Bachelors degree in finance or accounting preferred
 Detailed-oriented individual who works well independently on systematic projects.
 Expertise in comprehending financial statements, notes to the financial statements, capital account statements, and other information commonly provided by GPs.
 Experience preparing Client Reports ( Financial data)
 Self-motivated to meet internal KPIs, with the knowledge that consistently exceeding them can lead to career progression
 Meticulous when it comes to applying consistent methodologies when extracting data and attention to detail
 Ability to work accurately under pressure and meet team and client deadlines
 Working experience using Microsoft Excel (good at SUM, SUMIF, VLOOKUP, etc.)

Stable and Growing

The Scalers is a leader in its industry, with multiple offices across Europe and Asia.

Working for The Scalers offers you a stable and rewarding career. Our international team in Bengaluru (Indian, French, American) and our Chief Happiness Officer will ensure we have a tremendous experience together!

Neat Perks
 Comprehensive health insurance
 A MacBook Pro or Lenovo T490
 Business Trips worldwide
 Flexible timings
 Fun activities round the year
 Training & development
Freshly roasted coffee
 

Enhance Your Skills

At The Scalers we use the latest technologies and will always welcome your ideas to make our product better.

Our training and development programs make sure you always stay ahead of the curve and enhance your profile,

job details:
Target is an iconic brand, a Fortune 50 company and one of Americas leading retailers.Behind one of the worlds best loved brands is a uniquely capable and brilliant team of data scientists, engineers and analysts. The Target Data & Analytics team creates the tools and data products to sustainably educate and enable our business partners to make great data-based decisions. We help develop the technology that personalizes the guest experience, from product recommendations to relevant ad content. Were also the source of the data and analytics behind search engine optimisation, enterprise item strategy, target guest facing experiences and demand forecasting. We play a key role in identifying the test-and-measure or A/B test opportunities that continuously help Target improve the guest experience, whether they love to shop in stores or at Target.com.

A role with Data Analytics means being a part of the team that works closely with the business and identifies problems / opportunities. for improved decision-making through better data analysis. This covers the whole gamut from simple descriptive analysis to more complex predictive and prescriptive analytics. The emphasis is on actionable insights, which is possible through a combination of technical skills and business understanding.

As a Data Analyst for Digital, you will work closely with business teams and understand their priorities/roadmap. Based on this understanding, you are expected to identify appropriate metrics that will drive the right decisions for the business, and then build reporting solutions to deliver these metrics at the required frequency in an optimal and reliable fashion. You will also answer ad-hoc questions from your business users by conducting quick analysis on relevant data, identify trends and correlations, and form hypotheses to explain the observations. Some of these will lead to bigger analytical projects of increasing complexity, where you will work initially as a part of a bigger team, but also work independently as you gain more experience. Finally, you are expected to always adhere to project schedule and technical rigor as well as requirements for documentation, code versioning, etc.

Core responsibilities are described within this job description. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs.

About You:
 B.Tech / B.E. or equivalent experience
 2 + years of relevant experience
 Hands-on experience in analytics / data science
 Intermediate SQL skills
 Exposure to R, Python, Hive, or other open source languages preferable
 Big data experience preferable
 Strong written and verbal communication skills to explain complex analytical methodologies to clients regardless of the clients technical expertise
 Experience in A/B test
 Experience in Adobe analytics
 Understanding of foundational mathematics and statistics
 Conceptual understanding of analytical techniques like Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Time-series models, Classification Techniques, et,

job details:
Hey there! We're AKKO - a venture funded & fast-growing insurtech company with a passionate, solution-forward, and collaborative team focused on disrupting the device protection space.

Our mission is simple  Leveraging technology to make protecting people's tech easier and more affordable. Most people's lives have become tech-centric and AKKO provides customers with peace of mind that their tech is safe guarded in a transparent and seamless way. Backed by amazing investors such as Mundi, Fika, and Pear, we are just getting started!

We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst to focus on advancing analysis and reporting capabilities at AKKO. As part of a small team, the candidate will be responsible for the Whats (what needs to be tracked / reported on), the Hows (how will the data be collected and cleaned), and the Whys (why is the data showing particular behavior) of the analysis cycle. This role requires improvisation and coming up with elegant solutions on a daily basis. The candidate. will have the opportunity to implement their own ideas and work on AI/ML models.

THE DAY-TO-DAY
 Develop and execute the data strategy alongside executives to align with business goals and drive innovation
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including project managers, engineers, and executives, to define data needs, prioritize projects, and set clear objectives
 Conduct analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and opportunities for improving business performance and customer and partner experience
 Extract data from primary and secondary sources and removing corrupted data
 Identify key metrics and KPIs to track and monitor the success of various initiatives, providing regular updates and recommendations for improvement
 Build and maintain advanced statistical models and algorithms to generate predictive insights, forecasting business outcomes, and optimizing processes
 Continuously explore new data sources, techniques, and tools to enhance the quality and depth of data analysis
 Use data to analyze trends to help inform business policies and decisions
 Collaborate with engineers and developers to develop and streamline data governance strategies, ensuring data integrity, privacy, and compliance relevant regulations
 Implement quality assurance processes to validate data accuracy, consistency, and reliability, troubleshooting and resolving any issues that arise

WHAT MAKES YOU QUALIFIED
 3-5 years of experience working as a Senior Data Analyst or similar role (preferably with startup experience) with a track record of leading data-driven initiatives
 Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field
 Strong proficiency in SQL and data querying languages, with experience working with large and complex datasets
 Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker Studio) and statistical tools (e.g., R, Python)
 Experience with data governance, data quality management, and regulatory compliance
 Actuarial knowledge or experience is a plus
 All around team player, fast, and self-learning individual
 Proactive and solution-forward, bias for action
 Ability to drive forward work independently while communicating and working across functions
 Passion for data
 Experience working on high-scale, production-grade projects

NICE TO HAVES
 Experience working in the Insurtech space
 Experience working on AI/ML models

You will report to AKKO's Senior Data Analyst. The position disclosed is a contract position looking to be filled immediately. The contractor will be expected to commit to 40 hours of work per week (8 hours/day) and be available to work 9:00am-5:00pm EST.

This position is open to international applicants.

WHAT ELSE ARE WE LOOKING FOR 

Our team is fostered around our core values:
 Collaborate Work together to be more effective, lift up others, and win together
 Aim High Set ambitious goals
 Embrace Diversity Seek different perspectives, bring our true self to work
 Customer Love Serve the end user and listen to them
 Nurture Empathy Listen and strive to truly understand others
 Take Action Be proactive, be an owner, value speed
 Maintain Integrity Build the AKKO you are proud to work at
 Data Driven Use data to iterate, find truth

job details:
Job Summary:

The Global Health & Wellness Analytics group is seeking a Senior Data Analyst responsible for wrangling, harmonizing, and analyzing various disparate data sources. The successful candidate will have a keen understanding of healthcare claims data, a willingness to uncover insights from complex data, and strong communication skills in order to collaborate with multiple team members.

Additionally, they must be willing and able to find and implement potential solutions when minimal documentation or resources are readily available. The role will work closely with data engineers, analysts, and operational collaborators to validate medical data, create disease and screening cohorts, deliver curated datasets, and provide health insights via descriptive statistics, contingency tables, and basic statistical analyses (eg: Logistic regression).

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Clean and validate healthcare claims:
 Candidates will leverage tools such as SQL, R. and/or python to pull large amounts of healthcare claims data.
 The candidate will comb through these claims to ensure validity of claims, build cohorts, identify outcomes of interest, and perform basic statistical analyses.

Create curated tables of data:
 Candidates will be able to integrate and harmonize multiple disparate data sources to build curated tables for analytic purposes.
 For example, the candidate will combine claim records, Delta employee surveys, and Delta specific performance metrics to build a functional longitudinal dataset ready for analysis.

Provide high level insights:
 Candidates will provide insights to team members regarding each data source. These insights may come in the form of descriptive statistics, contingency tables, data visualizations, other summary views, or basic analyses.

Maintain and Document:
 Due to the dynamic nature of healthcare claims and billing, the candidate will be able to keep up to date with changing claim codes, groupings, and definitions.
 These changes will be maintained, detailed (via notes and version control methods such as Git), and communicated amongst team members.

What You Need To Succeed (Minimum Qualifications):
 Strong experience in Healthcare claims data analytics
 3-6 yrs of experience with handling, transforming, and analyzing healthcare claims data.
 Bachelors degree in data science, statistics, mathematics, computer science or engineering
 Strong command of data transformation skills using tools such as SQL, R, or Python amongst multiple disparate data sources.
 Strong relational database skills (SQL Server, Redshift, Alteryx or other)
 Experience in AWS environment with tools such as Glue, lambda, or Sagemaker
 High attention to detail, solution-oriented and capable of meeting or exceeding deadlines in a fast-paced environment
 Ability to problem solve within a team, as well as independently,
skills: SQL,R,Python,Data transformation,Glue,Healthcare claims data analytics,Relational database skills,AWS environment,Lambda,Sagemaker

job details:

In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

Who You Are

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

 Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions.

90 Days
 Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy,

job details:
As a Data Modeler, you will be responsible for designing and implementing logical and physical data models to support the organization's data management needs. Your role will involve collaborating with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into effective database designs. You will work closely with database administrators, developers, and other team members to ensure that the database structures are optimized for performance, scalability, and data integrity.

Responsibilities:

1. Requirement Gathering: Work closely with business analysts and stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for data storage, retrieval, and manipulation.

2. Logical Data Modeling:

- Develop conceptual and logical data models that accurately represent the business entities, attributes, and relationships.

- Normalize the data model to eliminate redundancy and ensure data integrity.

- Create entity-relationship diagrams (ERDs) to visualize the relationships between. different data entities.

3. Physical Data Modeling:

- Translate the logical data model into a physical data model optimized for a specific database management system (DBMS) or platform.

- Design database tables, columns, indexes, and constraints based on performance and scalability requirements.

- Optimize data storage and retrieval by implementing partitioning, indexing, and other techniques.

4. Data Governance:

- Define and enforce data standards, naming conventions, and data quality rules.

- Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices.

5. Collaboration:

- Collaborate with database administrators, developers, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment between data models and application requirements.

- Participate in cross-functional teams to integrate data models with software development projects.

6. Documentation:

- Document data models, including data dictionary definitions, metadata, and data lineage.

- Maintain documentation to facilitate understanding and future modifications of the data model.

7. Continuous Improvement:

- Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies related to data modeling and database design.

- Continuously improve data modeling processes and methodologies to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.

Requirements:

1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.

2. 3+ years of experience in data modeling, database design, or related roles.

3. Proficiency in data modeling tools such as ERwin, ER/Studio, or PowerDesigner.

4. Strong understanding of relational database concepts, SQL, and database management systems.

5. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

6. Effective communication and collaboration skills.

7. Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: 35,000.00 - 55,000.00 per month

Schedule:
 Day shift

Work Location: In person

Expected Start Date: 01/04/2024,
skills: Data Modeling,Logical Data Modeling,Physical Data Modeling,Data Governance,Collaboration,Documentation,Continuous Improvement,SQL,Database Management Systems

Job description

Job Title: Data Analyst - Fintech Company

Job Overview: As a Data Analyst at our cutting-edge fintech company, you will play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making and insights. Your primary responsibility will be to analyze, interpret, and present complex financial data, contributing to the development and optimization of our innovative financial products and services. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams to derive actionable insights from data, helping us stay at the forefront of the financial technology industry.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Data Analysis and Interpretation: Perform comprehensive analysis of financial data, including transactional records, market trends, customer behavior, and other relevant datasets to uncover meaningful insights and trends.

2. Reporting and Visualization: Prepare clear and concise reports, dashboards, and data visualizations that effectively communicate key findings and metrics to various stakeholders. including management, product teams, and clients.

3. Performance Tracking: Monitor and evaluate the performance of our financial products and services, providing actionable recommendations for improvements and optimizations.

4. Predictive Modeling: Develop and implement predictive models and statistical analyses to forecast business outcomes, identify potential risks, and explore new business opportunities.

5. Data Quality Assurance: Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and reliability by performing regular data cleansing and validation procedures.

6. Collaborative Partnerships: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders, to gather data requirements, understand business needs, and align data initiatives with overall company goals.

7. Market Research: Conduct market research and competitive analysis to gain insights into industry trends and inform data-driven decisions.

8. Data Governance and Compliance: Maintain a strong understanding of data privacy and compliance regulations, ensuring that all data-related practices are in accordance with relevant industry standards.

9. Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to enhance data collection, analysis, and reporting processes, actively contributing to the continuous improvement of data-related practices.

Qualifications and Skills:
 Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field. A Master's degree is a plus.
 Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in the financial sector or fintech industry.
 Strong knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
 Experience in statistical analysis, data modeling, and predictive analytics.
 Familiarity with financial concepts.
 Ability to work with large datasets and employ data analysis techniques to derive valuable insights.
 Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and understandable manner.
 Detail-oriented, analytical mindset, with a passion for solving challenging problems through data-driven approaches.
 Strong team player, capable of collaborating with diverse teams to achieve common goals.
 Flexibility and adaptability in a fast-paced and rapidly changing fintech environment.

Join our dynamic and innovative team, where your data expertise will drive the future of financial technology, shaping the way millions of customers manage their finances and investments. Apply now and be part of our mission to revolutionize the fintech industry!

job details:
About Allica Bank

Recently named by The Times newspaper as one of the UKs Top 20 financial technology (fintech) companies, Allica is a new bank that exists to empower established small and medium sized enterprises (SMEs) to succeed, through our unique combination of modern technology, local relationships, and tailored expertise.

Established SMEs are one of the last untapped opportunities in UK banking. They are the backbone of local communities - representing about a quarter of the economy - yet have been largely left behind both by traditional high street banks and modern fintech providers.

Weve grown rapidly and won multiple awards in our first year of trading, and you will be playing a key role as we continue to build a bank dedicated to established SMEs, at what is a crucial time for them. We believe that freedom, autonomy and trust bring the best out of people, so we work with team-players who get the importance of owning their responsibilities but know the value of. collaboration. We are curious, honest and supportive.

Role Description

Data is a key asset to Allica and is deeply embedded in all our teams and products. With data, we assist and work with Finance, Operations, Credit Risk, Product and management.

We are looking for ambitious and curious people who can help us understand our data better, contribute to facilitating the discussions between engineering and the data stakeholders and have an impact on the business by telling stories around the insights they generate.

You will be an integral part of the newly formed business intelligence team, building and developing the analytics and insights capabilities of the Bank.

Principal Accountabilities
 Understand our products and processes through the data we have or collect for product, finance, risk & ops teams
 Help the product, finance, risk & ops teams team leverage your knowledge of the data to provide insight, analysis and reporting
 Build dashboards and reports in Metabase for the product, finance, risk & ops teams

 Continuously improve product, finance, risk & ops teams reporting and ease of access to financial and operational information

 Develop and maintain data standards, always managing the data libraries and dictionaries, documenting your findings and sharing them both within and outside the data team
 Helping us implement a data-driven mindset in the company and within the product, finance, risk & ops teams
 Examples of work include building out the reports when we launch a new product or partnership, acquisition of a portfolio and supporting BAU activities

Personal Attributes & Experience
 Previous experience working as a data analyst using SQL.
 Strong and experienced level of analytical skills in a commercial environment ideally within banking or other financial services.
 You have a proven track record of data extraction and manipulation with SQL and building dashboards.
 You are flexible to adapt quickly to changing priorities within a very dynamic environment and work well with stakeholders across the business.
 You communicate effectively and are comfortable with translating technical detail into business and commercial language.
 Personable and able to communicate at all levels within the business.

environment in which to succeed in their role and in support of our customers.

 Private Medical Insurance - fully comprehensive cover for the employee and dependants
 22 days paid leave/ annual leave per year, excluding National & Festival holidays
 Discretionary bonus scheme
 Life assurance (30 Laks)
 Family friendly policies including enhanced Maternity & Paternity leave,

About Havas

Founded in 1835 in Paris, Havas is one of the worlds largest global communications networks, with more than 22,000 people in over 100 countries sharing one single mission: to make a meaningful difference to brands, businesses, and people. Havas has developed a fully integrated model through its 70+ Havas Villages around the world, covering all communication activities. The teams of the three business units, Havas Creative Network, Havas Media Network and Havas Health & You, work together with agility and in perfect synergy to offer tailor-made, innovative solutions to clients that support them in their positive transformation. Havas is committed to building a diverse culture where everybody feels they belong and can be themselves and thrive. Havas integrated into Vivendi, a global leader in media, entertainment, and communications, in December 2017.

Further information about Havas is available at www.havas.com.

About Havas India

Havas India gathers the expertise of 20 agencies and specialised divisions across 3 verticals: Havas Media Network  Havas Media, PivotRoots (integrated digital), Arena Media, Havas Media Tribes (out-of-home), Havas Market (e-commerce), Havas Play (sports, entertainment & content), Havas Programmatic Hub (programmatic trading desk), Havas Analytics (data & analytics), Socialyse (pure play social media), and Havas Play Gameplan (sports marketing); Havas Creative Network  Havas Worldwide India (creative), Havas People India (talent communications & employer branding), Havas CX India (customer experience), Think Design (UX/UI), Shobiz (experiential marketing), Shobiz Exhibits (exhibitions) Conran Design Group Mumbai (branding & design), PR Pundit Havas Red (PR), and Prose on Pixels (content-at-scale); Havas Health & You  Havas Life Sorento (health & wellness communications). With its unique Village model, it is an integrated network present across 3 Villages in Mumbai, Gurgaon and Bengaluru, and regional offices in Kolkata, New Delhi, Hyderabad and Chennai, with over 2000+ professionals and associates.

As one of Indias fastest growing and agile networks, Havas India has bagged multiple new clients across verticals and won several prestigious awards over the last 2 years including the group being Great Place To Work Certified twice in a row (Nov 2022 - Nov 2023 & Dec 2023  Dec 2024), consistently being featured in the top 3 at R3 New Business League rankings, and winning at Campaign Asia-Pacific Agency of the Year awards, e4m Indian Marketing Awards 2023, ABBY One Show 2023, Campaign Women Leading Change awards, and more. Our CSR programs, DE&I initiatives, and being actively involved in various industry associations is what keeps us invested as a network that has a clear mission of making a meaningful difference to brands, businesses and people.

For more information, visit https://in.havas.com/ and follow Havas India on social media.

About Havas Media Network India

Havas Media Network India is a media conglomerate that operates within a global framework  Mx  to drive Media Experiences and invest in Meaningful Media to build Meaningful Brands. The network offers a wide range of integrated marketing solutions covering strategy, media planning & buying, PR, social media, mobile, sports & entertainment, data, research & analytics services across traditional and digital media. It consists of media networks  Havas Media, PivotRoots and Arena Media, and specialist brands  Havas Market (e-commerce), Havas Play (entertainment, gaming, sports and fandom), Havas Play Gameplan (sports marketing), Havas Programmatic Hub (programmatic trading desk), Havas Analytics (data & analytics), Socialyse (social media), KlugKlug (influencer marketing) & Havas Media Tribes (out-of-home).

For more information, visit https://in.havas.com/ & follow Havas Media Network on social media,

Role: Data Analyst - On-Road evaluation Team (Electric Vehicle)

Job Description:

Overview:

We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our On-Road Evaluation Team focused on. Electric Vehicle (EV). In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing data collected from electric vehicles during on-road testing to support the development and validation of vehicle systems and components. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, proficiency in programming languages commonly used for data analysis, and a keen interest in electric vehicles and automotive technology.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to process, clean, and analyze CAN (Controller Area Network) data collected from electric vehicles during on-road testing. Extract meaningful insights related to vehicle performance, energy consumption, component behavior, and overall system health.

Measurement Analysis: Collaborate with the On-Road Durability Team to identify key performance metrics and develop analysis methodologies for evaluating the durability and reliability of electric vehicle systems and components. Conduct in-depth analysis of measurement data to identify

trends, anomalies, and potential areas for improvement.

Reporting and Visualization: Prepare comprehensive reports and

visualizations summarizing analysis findings, highlighting key performance

indicators, and providing actionable recommendations to stakeholders.

Present analysis results in a clear and concise manner to support

decision-making processes within the organization.

Modeling and Prediction: Work closely with engineers and researchers to

develop predictive models based on historical data analysis. Leverage

statistical modeling and machine learning techniques to forecast future

performance, identify potential failure modes, and optimize system design for

enhanced durability and reliability.

Data Management: Establish and maintain robust data management

practices, including data collection, storage, and documentation procedures.

Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and security throughout the analysis process,

adhering to relevant privacy regulations and industry standards.

Qualifications:

 Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, electrical Engineering,

Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.

 Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in the automotive or electric

vehicle industry.

 Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or MATLAB for data

manipulation and analysis.

 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to extract

actionable insights from complex datasets.

 Familiarity with CAN bus communication protocols and automotive data

acquisition systems is highly desirable.

 Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and

database management systems (e.g., SQL) is a plus.

 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to

collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and present technical

findings to non-technical stakeholders,
skills: Data Analysis,R,MATLAB,Statistical Modeling,Machine Learning,Data Management,Data Visualization,Programming Languages Python,CAN bus communication protocols,Automotive Data Acquisition Systems
