job details:
Data Analyst

Profile Summary

Exp: 4-6yrs

Location: Chennai/Bangalore/Hyderabad/Noida

As a Data Analyst, you will be accountable for querying, data wrangling, metadata preparation, and data cleansing tasks. Your role will be pivotal in ensuring the accuracy, reliability, and integrity of our data, which will contribute to informed decision-making and efficient business processes.

Responsibilities:

 Querying: Utilize SQL or other query languages to retrieve data from various databases, data warehouses, and data sources. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into effective queries.

 Data Wrangling: Clean, transform, and organize raw data from multiple sources into structured formats for analysis. Identify and resolve data inconsistencies, missing values, and anomalies. Apply data manipulation techniques to ensure data quality and consistency.

 Metadata Preparation: Develop and maintain metadata documentation, including data. dictionaries, data lineage, and data models. Ensure the accuracy and completeness of metadata to facilitate data discovery and understanding.

 Data Cleansing: Identify and address data quality issues by implementing data cleansing techniques. Validate data integrity and accuracy through data profiling and analysis. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to establish data quality standards and processes.

 Reporting and Visualization: Utilize reporting tools like Tableau, Power BI, and executive reporting suites to create visually appealing and insightful reports, dashboards, and executive summaries. Design and implement interactive visualizations to present data-driven insights to senior stakeholders.

 Analysis and Insights: Perform in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations. Generate actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic decision-making and business growth.

 Collaboration and Documentation: Collaborate with stakeholders, data engineers, and business users to understand data requirements, validate analysis results, and ensure data accuracy. Document data analysis methodologies, assumptions, and findings to maintain an auditable trail of analysis activities.

Required Skills:

 1-4 years of work experience in data analysis or a related field.

 Proficient in querying languages such as SQL, with experience in retrieving and manipulating data from relational databases.

 Strong data wrangling skills, including data cleaning, transformation, and integration.

 Familiarity with metadata management and preparation, ensuring data documentation is accurate and up-to-date.

 Experience with data cleansing techniques and tools to ensure data quality and integrity.

 Proficiency in reporting tools like Tableau, Power BI, and executive reporting suites, with the ability to create impactful visualizations and reports for senior stakeholders.

 Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to derive meaningful insights from complex data sets.

 Strong attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and reliability.

 Good communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.

Join our dynamic team and contribute to our data-driven decision-making processes. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in maintaining high data quality standards and delivering valuable insights to drive business growth.

Salary: 255,404.62 - 1,301,792.43 per year

job details:
Data Analyst- Project Systems

Make your ability count at NNE.

We are experts in end-to-end pharma engineering, and our success is built on our relationships, both with our colleagues and our customers. If you want to work on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.

Why should you join us 

You will become an integral part of a team within Project Management department. In the role of a Data Analyst, your primary focus will involve close collaboration with internal stakeholders to provide support and ensure the seamless operation of our systems. You would be building innovative, efficient, and robust applications/automations/dashboards to support day to day operations and to provide better data driven insights to project teams.

Your enthusiasm for embracing new technologies and your strong knowledge within the MS Power Platform and MS Office 365 allows you to introduce best practices and practical solutions to NNE's. operations by use of the full suite from MS Office 365.

Location: Bangalore, India

Seniority: 1-3 years

Department Project Systems

How You Might Spend Your Days

As a Data Analyst youll be working with innovative, multi-disciplinary team which includes a group of colleagues from same or different disciplines, where youll:
 Microsoft Power Apps
 PowerApps: PowerApps integration, Design, Develop and deployment of Canvas apps, Model driven and Power Pages
 Data Integration and Connectivity: Connectors, Common Data Service (CDS), Delegation in PowerApps  How does it impact data retrieval and processing.
 Security: considerations for data privacy and compliance, Role-based access control (RBAC) in PowerApps
 PowerApps triggers workflows in Flow, Strategies for optimizing the performance of PowerApps.
 Microsoft Power Automate
 Power Automate: End to End Power Automate Development, Flow Integration, Automation for Business use cases
 Integrate Power Automate flows across Microsoft power platform applications (ex: PowerBI, SharePoint, PowerApps, Dataverse)
 PowerBI
 PowerBI: Data Transformation, Visualization, Power Query
 PowerBI Service: Capable of creating BI dataflows and datasets and maintaining Power BI Service connections.
 Creating and understanding Power BI DAX formulas and terminologies, and creating measures based on use cases and error handling
 Power BI data connections and data modeling, proficient in integrating SharePoint, SQL server data sources and adept at consolidating diverse datasets to generate reports.
 SharePoint
 SharePoint data management, data extraction and consolidation.
 SharePoint integration to Power BI and Power Automation
 Excel
 Excel: Lookups, Functions, Power Query for data consolidation and transformation.
 VBA & Macros: Proficient in VBA for automating data tasks.
 Data Connection: For connecting, merging, and cleaning data from multiple sources.
 Power BI Integration: Ability to connect Live Excel data to Power BI for live reporting.
 SQL
 SQL queries using Window Functions, Stored Procedures, CTEs, Functions and Temp Tables
 Database Administration: Competent in database management, maintenance, and security.
 Data Integration: Experienced in integrating data from various sources into SQL databases.
 Data Modeling: Skilled in designing efficient database models for report generation.
 Other Microsoft Power Platform Technologies
 Dataverse Design and implementation

Who you are.

At NNE, we care about who you are as a person. In the end, how you work, and your energy is what impacts the work we do as a team. As a person, you are:

Understanding of your colleagues individual and cultural differences

A good listener who always comes with solutions

Able to priorities urgent tasks

Motivated by working independently and repetitive tasks

You are curious and having a Zeal to learn

like to work independently and have a strong personal drive.

innovative in solving everyday challenges.

Creating improvements in methods

An entrepreneur mindset

The miles youve walked.

To apply for the position there are some things that are needed, and others a bonus. We believe these qualifications are needed for you to succeed in this role:

You have a bachelors degree within IT, economics, engineering, computer science, statistics or similar

You have minimum 4 years of experience

Experience From a Consultancy Or Contractor /Data Management Company

1-2 years of experience from working in a matrix organization, e.g. from the consultancy business or another project-oriented environment

Experience in communicating complex data to decision makers

Solid experience in working with data, including extracting, transform and analyzing data and identifying trends and forecast preferably utilizing tools like

You speak and write technical English fluently.

Were experts bound by a noble cause and driven by passion.

NNE is short for Novo Nordisk Engineering. And for all of us who work here, NNE means so much more. Some of us are driven by working on highly complex projects together with other leading experts. Others are inspired by a work environment with flat hierarchy and flexible conditions. And some love the fact that they work for a world leading engineering consultancy within the pharma industry. If there's one thing, we all share, it's the passion for what we do. Together we design and build pharma facilities that are essential for millions of patients all over the world.

Sounds like something youd like to do  If youre ready to join our passion, lets hear from you.

Deadline of application is April 2nd, 2024

Questions before applying  Please contact hidden_email

Please note we only accept applications submitted through our online recruitment system.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, we encourage you to refrain from adding a photo in your CV. At NNE, we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

We will invite to interviews on a running basis.

To learn more about us visit www.nne.com,

job details:
As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing large datasets, identifying trends, and generating actionable insights to inform strategic initiatives and drive business performance. Leveraging your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and data visualization, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to solve complex business problems and optimize processes. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on diverse projects, lead data-driven initiatives, and make a meaningful impact in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.

Responsibilities
 Lead the analysis of large datasets to extract meaningful insights and identify trends, patterns, and correlations that drive business value
 Develop and implement statistical models, machine learning algorithms, and predictive analytics techniques to forecast business metrics, detect anomalies, and optimize decision-making processes
 Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, define. project objectives, and translate business needs into actionable data analysis and reporting solutions
 Design and develop data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms to communicate insights and facilitate data-driven decision-making
 Conduct exploratory data analysis, data cleansing, and data preprocessing to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and integrity of datasets
 Mentor junior analysts, providing guidance on data analysis techniques, best practices, and tools, and fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement
 Stay current with emerging trends, technologies, and methodologies in data analysis, attending conferences, workshops, and training sessions as appropriate

Mandatory Requirements
 Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field
 4+ years of experience in data analysis or business intelligence roles, with a focus on analyzing large datasets and generating actionable insights
 Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and querying from relational databases
 Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or similar for data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning
 Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar for creating interactive dashboards and reports
 Solid understanding of statistical concepts, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and predictive modeling techniques

Qualities
 Excellent problem-solving skills, critical thinking abilities, and attention to detail
 Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively present complex findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders

Benefits
 Competitive salary and benefits package
 Opportunities for professional development and career advancement
 Exposure to cutting-edge technologies and industry best practices
 Dynamic and collaborative work environment
 Potential for remote work options and flexible work hours

Location: Onsite, Remote, Hybrid,
skills: Data Analysis,Statistical Modeling,Data Visualization,SQL,Python,R,Machine Learning,Predictive Analytics,Tableau,Power BI,Hypothesis Testing,Regression Analysis

job details:
Job Description

Sr. Data Analyst, Navi Mumbai

Roles & Responsibilities

Roles & Responsibilities

The Data Instrumentation team is part of the Software Core Services Services in the organization and is responsible for architecture, design, and management of Instrumentation and Analysis for the entire Mixed Reality ecosystem.

The Senior Data Analyst position is an individual contributor role. He/she will work as an interface between Developers, Engineers, and Management. He/she is passionate about data instrumentation and analysis.
 Designing and maintaining instrumentation , data systems and processes to gather, clean, and transform and visualise data related to Tesseracts JioGlass customers and Developer Ecosystem
 Use statistical techniques and tools to analyse datasets and interpret patterns and trends and gather insights and provide reports to various stakeholders
 Serve as custodian of data systems and data management processes in the organisation so that technology. product and business teams can understand this data and use it to arrive at solutions and strategies to accelerate Tesseracts JioGlass and Developer Ecosystem.
 Work closely with other engineers and product teams to identify the data analysis requirements related to Devices (Operating System and Electronics), SDKs, Experience/Applications, etc.
 Design and implement solutions by leveraging Big Data technology and AI.
 Build high standards of data analysis and advocate data-driven culture company-wide.
 Mentor other Data Analysts in the team

Job Specification
 Bachelor degree or above 4+ years industry experience in data analytics.
 Strong mathematics and statistics background. Extensive knowledge and hands-on experiences in statistics, data analysis, big data processing and parallel computing frameworks such as Hadoop and Spark.
 Hands-on experience with SQL or Hive Query
 Logical thinker with strong problem solving and analytical ability to apply your mathematical, algorithmic and other expertise to solve real problems.

job details:
Company Description

Daxko powers health & wellness throughout the world. Every day our team members focus their passion and expertise in helping health & wellness facilities operate efficiently and engage their members.

Whether a neighborhood yoga studio, a national franchise with locations in every city, a YMCA or JCC--and every type of organization in between--we build solutions that make every aspect of running and being a member of a health and wellness organization easier and delightful.

Job Description

As a Marketing and Sales Operations Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing marketing and sales data to provide insights and recommendations to improve overall business performance. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze data, develop reports and dashboards, and identify trends and opportunities. Your role will be instrumental in optimizing marketing and sales strategies, enhancing customer engagement, and driving revenue. growth.

You will also:
 Collect, clean, and analyze marketing and sales data from various sources, including Salesforce and Hubspot
 Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in the data to uncover insights and opportunities for improvement.
 Monitor data integrity and accuracy within marketing and sales databases.
 Work closely with IT, finance, and other departments to integrate data from different systems and ensure data consistency.
 Design and implement A/B tests and experiments to measure the effectiveness of marketing strategies and optimize conversion rates.
 Utilize statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms to segment customer populations, personalize marketing communications, and improve targeting accuracy.
 Communicate findings and insights effectively to stakeholders at all levels, including executives, marketers, sales representatives, and IT professionals.
 Implement data cleansing and enrichment processes to ensure high-quality data for analysis and reporting
 Create dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and track marketing performance against predefined goals and objectives for data integrity and collection.
 Stay current with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in marketing analytics, and proactively identify opportunities for innovation and optimization.

Qualifications
 Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or related field. OR Equivalent professional experience
 Four or more (4+) years of experience in marketing Ops, sales operations, or business intelligence roles.
 Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis using SQL, Python, R, or similar programming languages.
 Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio.
 Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate technical findings into business recommendations.
 Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality.
 Strong understanding of statistical analysis, experimental design, and predictive modeling techniques.
 Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 Strong supervisory and leadership skills.
 Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.

Preferred (but not required):
 Experience with CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce) and marketing automation platforms (e.g., HubSpot, Marketo)

Additional Information

Daxko is dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce. We are committed to diversity in the broadest sense, including thought and perspective, age, ability, nationality, ethnicity, orientation, and gender. The skills, perspectives, ideas, and experiences of all of our team members contribute to the vitality and success of our purpose and values.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines,
skills: SQL,Python,R,Data Visualization,Tableau,Power BI,Statistical Analysis,Experimental Design,Predictive Modeling,Google Data Studio

job details:
Job Description

Position Purpose

This role is intended to provide data analysis and setup the automated reporting, controls and monitoring for the regulatory reporting team or assimilate (Compliance, top management, IG, Business) on an ad hoc and a regular basis using a variety of analytical tools and SQL.

The ODIN Team is part of ITO GM IT, which looks to satisfy the requirements related to regulatory reporting control & monitoring asked by end users represented by OPS Regulatory Reporting or/and C.M.I on four pillars :

  Data Analysis: Perform and document analysis, review and study on specified regulatory topics. Understand business change and requirement needs, assess the impact and the cost.

  Data visualization : Data visualization analysts deliver data in useful and appealing ways to users

  Data Mining: The extraction of patterns and knowledge from large amounts of data from the database ODIN in order to answer to questions, investigations or controls needs.

  Data. Science : use of scientific methods to obtain useful information from data available in Relational database to automate process & controls.

Responsibilities

Direct Responsibilities

  Set up automated controls - Put in place controls based on user requirements/needs

  Specialized area of expertise required (one or more area) - Regulatory topics e.g.: MIFID, Transaction Reporting etc.

  Management of workload - Experience in prioritizing and systematically organizing tasks, demonstrating sensitivity to urgent matters, completing tasks in a timely manner

  Analysis/Problem solving   Very good with analytical and problem solving skills, should be able to proactively find out the issues and suggest/implement the solutions.

  Communication   Should be able to articulate the information to be shared in the understandable way to the people from different background (technical/non-technical). Should possess excellent presentation skills.

Contributing Responsibilities

  Prioritization of the tasks and keeping good balance of technical and functional knowledge.

  Contributing to the team to work in agile framework.

  Work closely with developers and help them to understand concepts to achieve the target

  Suggest optimized solutions and work towards implementation of them.

Technical & Behavioral Competencies

  Good understanding on Relational databases and should be able to use SQL.

  Data mining and analysis.

  Basic understanding on ETL process.

  Curiosity and analysis skills and willingness to learn.

  Good Communication skills.

  Quality-focused with a good eye for detail.

  Capacity to work in a high-pressure environment.

  Must be able to work closely with distributed teams.

  Willing to share knowledge and skills with other developers within the team.

  Whilst able to work independently, should be a true team player.

  Creativity and Problem solving attitude.

Specific Qualifications (if required)

  Bachelor/Master's Degree in engineering in computer science or/and financial markets   Advanced knowledge of SQL systems, with experience developing in Oracle environment

  Good functional knowledge on financial products and on Regulatory topics (EMIR, MIFID, CFTC )

  Knowledge of visualization tools like Microsoft Power BI or Oracle Apex

  Write clear technical and functional specification.

  Knowledge of Python and Elastic Search.

  Experience with machine learning or AI is a plus.

  Autonomous, rigorous, collaborative mindset, good management of stress.

Skills Required

Data Analysis SQL Query python Data mining

Location

Mumbai

Years Of Experience

4 to 9 Years,

Introduction

The founding of Metropolitan dates to as early as 1898 and Momentum traces its roots to being established in 1966. Momentum Metropolitan Holdings was formed from the merger of Metropolitan and Momentum, two sizeable and diverse insurance-based financial services companies in South Africa and was listed on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange on 1 December 2010.

In order to grow its international footprint and diversify its revenue streams, Momentum Metropolitan actively pursues financially viable opportunities across the world. Aditya Birla Health Insurance Company Limited, a joint venture with Aditya Birla Capital Limited, was incorporated in 2015 and was our first expansion into India.

Having experienced. India first-hand as a hub of both talent and opportunity, we set up Momentum Metropolitan Services in 2017, a wholly-owned Mumbai-based global in-house centre to leverage IT, ITES and Business support services to all our businesses worldwide.

Role Purpose

The purpose of this role is to source and profile data from multiple sources for reporting needs as defined by business. Designing data collection processes to collect and extract, transform, analyse, interpret, evaluate, and visualize data while working alongside various teams, both inside and outside of the BU. job details:
Position Description

Under the direction of HR BI Analytics Director, the Senior Consultant will operate as a key member of the HR Analytics team, identifying and performing consultative analytics to senior leadership and supporting the HR community.

Your future duties and responsibilities
 Deliver timely and accurate analyses to our executives and HR community for ad hoc requests.
 Serve as an HR analytics subject matter expert to conduct analyses and provide consultative support and strategic direction for new and existing HR analytical initiatives.
 Explore and implement advanced analytical methodologies, including data visualization, predictive analytics and statistical modeling.
 Provide analytics support to our HR user community, for recurring and daily ad hoc inquiries.
 Support and maintain strategic analytical tools, including collaboration with our IT development team.
 Gather requirements to design and develop dashboards using Oracle DV.
 Analyze data and. statistics for trends and patterns with attention to turnover, recruitment, resource management, training and development, and organizational model.
 Build and maintain strong working relationships with various stakeholders.
 Ensures compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role
 Bachelors or Masters degree, or equivalent, in a related field.
 Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Communicating effectively and tactfully with all levels of management.
 Fluency in English; French is a nice to have.
 5+ years of experience in data management and data analytics using tools such as Excel, DV, Tableau, Power BI, SQL.
 Delivering accurate and timely information while working in a fast-paced, time-sensitive environment;
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 Experience with MS Office tools (especially PowerPoint, Word and Excel).
 Knowledge of Human Resource areas of expertise.
 Preparing and delivering written and verbal presentations for a variety of audiences.
 Manage multiple assignments while adapting by shifting work in response to executive requests.
 Extremely reliable and dependable; thorough and meticulous, with great attention to detail.
 Innovative self-starter with the ability to work as an independent contributor and a positive team member.
 Maintain strict confidentiality and discretion in all areas of work.
 Experience working with a global team, whose members come from different cultural backgrounds, is a plus.

Insights you can act on

While technology is at the heart of our clients digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.

When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees members because they are CGI shareholders and owners, and, as owners, we enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are todayone of the worlds largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.

At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where everyone belongs, and we collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal opportunity employer, we empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.

Ready to become part of our success story  Join CGIwhere your ideas and actions make a difference,

As a Senior Data Analyst & Application Builder at Palantir Foundry, you will be a seasoned professional who combines data analysis expertise with application development skills. Additionally, youll play a pivotal role in enhancing data visualization and storytelling to empower users in making informed decisions.

 Data-Focused Project Execution:
 Manage the execution of data-focused projects within the LEAR foundry team, utilizing Lears data analytics and application platform.
 Participate in multiple projects from their inception, contributing to defining the problem statement
 Support to contribute and execute a long-term data strategy aligned with business goals and associate data. management with business strategy.

 Conduct open-ended analysis using Contour and Quiver to extract insights from complex datasets.
 Translate analysis findings into actionable recommendations.

 Minimum 5 years of experience in data engineering, ETL, and data integration.
 Proven experience in application development, preferably within a data-driven environment.

job details:
Job Title:

Data Management Analyst

Short Description :

With exponential year-over-year growth of data generated, strong Data Governance, including Data Quality, is critical to ensure clean, fit-for-purpose data. The Corporate and Investment Bank (CIB) Chief Data Office (CDO) is responsible for defining and implementing the Firmwide Data Management strategy to create an industry-leading data environment.

Posting Description :

The successful candidate will join a team focused on delivering business impact through transformation of Data Quality management. The role will require working with stakeholders across the Corporate and Investment Bank, other Lines of Business (LOBs) and Corporate Functions to ensure fit-for-purpose data, looking to leverage best practice across the industry and other J.P. Morgan business units.

This role provides an outstanding opportunity for the selected candidate to join a high-profile team at JPMorgan Chase and take a partnership role, supporting one. of the Banks most significant change programs.

Job summary :

As a Data Management Analyst within the Corporate Investment Banking Chief Data Office, you will be instrumental in revolutionizing our Data Quality management. You will work closely with stakeholders across different departments to guarantee fit-for-purpose data, utilizing industry best practices. This role offers a unique opportunity to join a high-profile team at JPMorgan Chase and assume a collaborative role, backing one of the Bank's most substantial change programs. Your duties will encompass implementing and supporting Data Quality practices, managing and prioritizing Data Quality issues, and working with Business stakeholders & Technology teams to bolster data quality initiatives.

Job responsibilities :
 Demonstrate good understanding of data governance, data quality & data lineage
 Implement and support Data Quality (DQ) practices across the CIB:
 Govern and triage DQ Issues as it progresses through the lifecycle
 Accelerate data quality issue level root cause analysis and resolution through effective program governance, process mapping and data deep-dives
 Discuss and agree technical resolutions with technology teams to remediate DQ issues
 Discover and document data-lineage to trace the end-to-end data journey from point of creation to consumption
 Set up data profiling and DQ rules leveraging DQ tools like Collibra, Informatica and other emerging tools
 Leverage productivity tools such as Alteryx and visualization tools such as Tableau to analyze large dataset to draw inferences
 Collaborate & Build strong partnerships with Business stakeholders & Technology teams to support data quality efforts
 Demonstrates Teamwork by collaborating with others to integrate ideas & achieve common goals

Required qualifications, capabilities and skills :
 5+ years experience in Financial Services with Data Quality / Data Lineage / Business Analysis background
 Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Capacity to think laterally and convey an understanding of the big picture
 Proficiency in manipulating and analyzing large data sets in Excel (pivots, formulas, charts, etc.)
 Excellent communication, presentation (both oral and written) & influencing skills - candidate will be dealing with stakeholders of varying degrees of seniority across Corporate/Firmwide, Finance, Risk, Compliance, Operations and Technology teams
 Self-starter, able to work autonomously, with strong time management skills; efficient at multi-tasking and able to work under pressure to deliver multiple business demands on-time, to a high standard
 Basic understanding of the company's business practices and familiarity with the company's products and services

Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills :
 Experience in CIB and CDO/Data Quality organization
 Experience in querying database/data stores for data analysis.
 Experience in producing PowerPoint presentations for senior audiences
 Exposure to tools/technologies such as Alteryx/Tableau/SQL/Informatica/Collibra

JPMorgan Chase is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, M/F/D/V,

job details:
About Us:

Wolters Kluwer is a global leader in professional information services. Professionals in the areas of legal, business, tax, accounting, finance, audit, risk, compliance, and healthcare rely on Wolters Kluwer's market leading information-enabled tools and software solutions to manage their business efficiently, deliver results to their clients, and succeed in an ever more dynamic world. Wolters Kluwer combines deep domain knowledge with specialized technology. Our portfolio offers software tools coupled with content and services that customers need to make decisions with confidence. Every day, our customers make critical decisions to help save lives, improve the way we do business, build better judicial and regulatory systems. We help them get it right.

The Role
 In this role, you will contribute towards solution development using Python, Tableau/Power BI and Advanced Excel for a range of data analytics problems.
 You will be working within the Wolters Kluwer FSS. organization to support the Financial Leadership in identifying financial strategic needs and directions for FSS.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis for Capacity and Volume Understanding:
 Analyze customer behavior to understand its impact on capacity and volume, such as revenue/volumes by customer segments, product usage behavior, and seasonal variations.
 Identify correlations between volumes and variable costs, as well as the impact on temporary help and overtime costs.

Forecast Model Preparation:
 Create forecast models based on historical trends, vendor invoices, and volume data to predict future trends.

Business Opportunity Identification and Optimization:
 Assist in identifying business unit opportunities and challenges by continually reviewing and analyzing financial and operational data.
 Model trends, identify relationships, and spot opportunities.
 Test hypotheses and alternatives to find optimal solutions.
 Collaborate with other leaders to identify new business models and workflows.
 Assist in building business cases for necessary investments and strategic plans to achieve planned results.

Report and Dashboard Improvement:
 Simplify, standardize, and automate existing reports and dashboards.
 Enhance visualization and drill-down capabilities to provide better insights for Root Cause Analysis.

Data Mining and Analytics Skills:
 Proficient in data mining and data analytics to derive insights from various datasets.

Stakeholder Management
 Foster positive and professional relationships with all stakeholders in the workplace for effective collaboration and communication

Key Skills And Experience Required.
 Required experience in Data science 5 years at least
 Required: Bachelors degree in data science/analytics, finance, accounting, or economics or Engineering in Computer Science, or related quantitative field
 Required - Visualization tools (like Tableau, Power BI etc)
 Strong python programming skills for data transformations with packages such as numpy and pandas
 Knowledge of connecting to various types of data sources through python as well as dashboarding tools
 Sound knowledge of statistical modelling
 Strong analytical skills; capable of multi-tasking in fast-paced, dynamic environment
 Ability to communicate effectively to multiple constituencies in multiple platforms including email.
 Experience of Data engineering will be a plus point.
 Ability to mentor team members / colleagues especially in technical aspects such as debugging, right coding practices or analysis methodology.
 Pricing execution and/or sales support experience is preferred.

Travel requirements:

Limited to 1-2 weeks a year (if any)

Physical Demands

Minimum 2 days working from office (Pune-Kalyani Nagar).

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by most people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities and requirements,

job details:
Senior Clinical Data Analyst

The Senior Clinical Data Analyst (SCDA) independently performs/lead and/or coordinate all clinical data.

Validation activities on assigned projects, commensurate with experience and/or project role, with high degree of proficiency and autonomy.

Further responsibilities shall include providing technical expertise and/or operational leadership regarding all DM operational activities (data cleaning matrices), processes and Data Management documents regarding data validation.

All tasks should be performed in accordance to corporate quality standards, SOPs/Work Instructions/Guidelines, ICH-GCP and/or other international regulatory requirements.

SCDA acts as a subject matter expert on DM Systems/processes, providing technical support and expert advice to internal and external sponsors.

The SCDA may act as a back-up to or fulfill the Data Management Lead role where required.

Skills

 Good understanding of Clinical Study Team roles within Data Management . awareness of DML activities e.g.: budget reviews, resource forecast, etc.

 Experience in clinical research industry.

 Advanced knowledge of medical terminology and coding dictionaries (e.g. MedDRA & WHODRUG).

 Advanced knowledge of Data Management Operational processes and tasks during study start-up, conduct and close-out.

 Advanced knowledge of Database set-up activities, including but not limited to Database

Configuration Specifications and setup of Data Validation.

 Basic knowledge of SAS (programmed listings).

 Basic knowledge of Data standards (CDISC).

 Good understanding of financial principles/drivers for management of DM project financials with regards to forecasting and scope of work.

 Proven experience of leading virtual/global Data Management operational team/s to perform DB setup, data cleaning activities.

Education:

 Bachelors degree and / or other medical qualifications or relevant industry experience.

 Certification or involvement in a professional society or organization is recommended.

job details:
Senior Data Analyst

The Senior Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in deciphering complex datasets,

pinpointing trends, and offering actionable insights to facilitate data-driven decision-

making. The ideal candidate should have a robust background in data analysis, data

modelling, and data visualisation. They should exhibit exceptional analytical skills,

meticulous attention to detail, and the ability to communicate insights effectively to

stakeholders. The Senior Data Analyst will work alongside cross-functional teams to

extract and transform data, develop analytical models, and provide strategic

recommendations to enhance business performance.

Job Description

 Transform vague business queries into precise business and technical

requirements that guide data analysis and interpretation.

 Analyse data from diverse sources across various channels, ensuring data

integrity and accuracy throughout the process.

 Leverage reporting and data visualisation tools to identify. key performance

indicators and create performance tracking summaries for effective monitoring

and decision-making.

 Conduct thorough data investigations to identify and address data quality issues,

anomalies, and outliers, ensuring data reliability and consistency.

 Carry out detailed analysis on customer behaviour, combining structured and

unstructured datasets to uncover valuable insights and trends.

 Develop actionable recommendations based on quantitative analysis, translating

findings into strategic initiatives and improvements.

 Implement statistical models to support marketing strategies and planning,

enhancing targeting, segmentation, and campaign optimisation efforts.

 Provide advanced analytics support for segmentation, campaign optimisation,

and personalisation initiatives, leveraging data-driven insights to drive customer

engagement and satisfaction.

 Present findings, recommendations, and insights to senior management and

stakeholders in a clear, concise, and impactful manner, facilitating informed

decision-making and driving business success.

Skill and Experience

 A solid background in quantitative analysis or engineering, with a degree in

Actuarial, Statistics, Computing, or Business (Marketing).

 A minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience in data analytics, preferably

within the CRM domain.

 Comprehensive understanding of relational databases and SQL.

 Familiarity with Python, Databricks, or R.

 Proficiency in data visualisation tools, such as Tableau or PowerBI

 Strong grasp of database concepts and data management is essential.

 Experience with cloud-based database and analytics services such as Azure,

AWS, or GCP.

 Understanding of business processes and data flows that generate and utilise

data.

 A curious mindset with a willingness to learn and an interest in emerging

data/digital technologies.

 Ability to work independently with excellent English communication skills.

 Capability to translate complex analytics methodologies and results into

understandable terms for a non-technical audience.

 A strong analytical mind with meticulous attention to detail.

Job Type: Permanent

Salary: From 1,500,000.00 per year

Experience:
 data analyst: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

Usual stakeholders are Application Owners, Delivery Managers, Architecture teams, Data Scientists, DevOps, Security, Integration Factory, Infrastructure teams, Platform Support teams, ISRM team as well as Product Owners.

 Design and manage the development of modular. reusable, elegantly designed and maintainable software or solutions that supports the Procurement organization as well as other Cross Functional strategic initiatives.
 Participate fit-gap workshops with business providing effort estimates and solutions proposals.

job details:
Position Summary.

Demonstrates up-to-date expertise and applies this to the development, execution, and improvement of action plans by providing expert advice and guidance to others in the application of information and best practices; supporting and aligning efforts to meet customer and business needs; and building commitment for perspectives and rationales. Provides and supports the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders; identifying business needs; determining and carrying out necessary processes and practices; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities; and adapting to competing demands, organizational changes, and new responsibilities. Models compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by incorporating these into the development and implementation of business plans; using the Open Door. Policy; and demonstrating and assisting others with how to apply these in executing business processes and practices.

What you'll do.

About Team - Data Ventures

We are an upstart team, akin to a nimble start up incubated within Walmart, building the best-in-class Suite of Data Products to deliver actionable, customer-centric insights and help merchants and suppliers make better business decisionson omni channel 360 performance.

In Data Ventures, work happens in a fast-paced, results-driven agile environment with varied responsibilities. We have a deep interest and passion for technology. We are building a team that loves writing and owning codes and enjoy working with people who will keep challenging the team at every stage.

What you'll do:

A Senior Data Analyst is responsible for combining his analytical strength, logic building, consulting mind with product focus and business understanding to deliver for our business stakeholders and product leaders.
 Demonstrate strong thought-leadership and consult with product and business stakeholders to build, scale and deploy holistic analytics products after successful prototyping.
 Understand business processes, identify the correct data sources and validate the quality of the data sources, work with engineers to develop a high quality data product
 Interface with business stakeholders to proactively identify opportunities, develop business acumen and cultivate stakeholder relationships
 Explore data and perform data analysis to support business requirements
 Analyse and visualize the business impact of data products; document analytical methodologies used in the execution of data products
 Build dashboards to help deliver business insights
 Participate in internal technical councils and represent the organization in forums that involve community of analytics professionals across industry and academia.
 Promote and support company policies, procedures, mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity.

What you'll bring:

Minimum qualifications:
 Bachelor's Degree or Masters Degree with 6+ years of experience in Computer Science or statistics or engineering or related field.
 Experience as a business/data analyst in e-commerce or retail
 Experience with SQL based querying languages (MS SQL, MY SQL, HIVE)
 Understanding of Big data and cloud Infrastructure (Hadoop, GCP & Azure)
 Experience on data visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker etc.
 Ability to operate in an ambiguous environment and deliver results
 Excellent written and verbal communications skills
 Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams in different time zones
 Experience in consulting is a plus

Additional Qualifications:
 Good to have experience in financial analytics, cloud analytics, supply chain or retail analytics
 Years Of Experience: 6 to 10 Years
 Education/Qualification: Any Graduate/PG

About Walmart Global Tech.

Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people and put a smile on their face. Thats what we do at Walmart Global Tech. Were a team of 15,000+ software engineers, data engineers, data analysts, data scientists and service professionals within Walmart, the worlds largest retailer, delivering innovations that improve how our customers shop and empower our 2.3 million associates. To others, innovation looks like an app, service or some code, but Walmart has always been about people. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations.Being human-led is our true disruption.

Flexible, hybrid work:

We use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives.

Benefits:

Benefits Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include a host of best-in-class benefits maternity and parental leave, PTO, health benefits, and much more.

Minimum Qualifications.

Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.

Minimum Qualifications:Option 1: Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Arts, Finance or related field and 2 years" experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field. Option 2: Master's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field. Option 3: 4 years" experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field.

Preferred Qualifications.

Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.

Primary Location.

Key Responsibilities
 Develop logical business rules instructing how to process, validate, transform and derive data using D&B protocols and standards
 Responsible for real-time aggregation of large amounts of data from various sources that includes streaming and batch data into a data lake.
 Manage the implementation of the rules into production environments, adhering to required data management and governance practices
 Perform data analysis using a variety of. database query and visualization tools to identify and understand issues or events
 Provide technical expertise in extracting, integrating, and analyzing critical data
 Enable decision-making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources to present it in a digestible and actionable format
 Write test case scenarios, prepare test data and perform User Acceptance testing
 Create documentation, reports and dashboards to support the effective management and operation of the platform

Key Requirements:
 Min 6 yrs of total experience in Data Engineering and experience working as a member of one or more agile teams and SCRUM methodology
 Robust data knowledge preferably around business data sets with proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses
 Strong Data Modelling & Mapping knowledge along with experience in XML & JSON document formats
 Experience of ETL & Data Processing using Cloud Based Technologies (GCP Preferred)
 Knowledge of DevOps experience with CI/CD pipelines, Configuration Management tools, Scripting
 Strong communication skills with the ability to collaborate and build cross team relations
 Proven ability to drive results and to implement complex, technical, multi-organizational programs
 Passionate and curious about data with the ability to query and analyze datasets in order to drive fact- based decisions
 Able to work independently with minimal supervision.
 Willing to learn new skills and implement new technologies.
 A Degree in Data Science, Information Systems, Computer Science, Business, Economics, Mathematics or similar

job details:
About Spendgo

Spendgo, Inc. is headquartered in San Francisco, CA and is a well-funded company that has been around for over 12 years. Spendgo is in the loyalty space.

Were proud to have big international brands like MTY and Kahala Management which own Thai Express and Coldstone Creamery as our customers.

All this is possible by having sophisticated technology to understand and parse online receipt transactions, a campaign engine that rewards points and offers based on predefined rules, and integrations with various Messaging Providers and POS systems using our APIs. Big Data and analytics are a huge part of what we do - from driving on-site behavior to e-commerce sales and customer engagement.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who likes working with the latest technologies, solving, architecting and building solutions for complex business problems. Were in the process of exponential growth as we take on new opportunities and target new segments. Its a great time to. be joining us!

 Expert-level ability to write complex, optimized SQL queries across large data sets.

We are looking for a data analyst/scientist/expert to help drive our analytical and technical efforts to enable OpenInvest to deliver highly personalized financial solutions on a large scale. As a leading provider of values-based data-driven financial products, you will join our team to advance our investment methodology creation and testing and analytics capabilities by building internal tools and models. This will involve leveraging various techniques such as data analysis, visualization, and tool development.

Job Responsibilities:
 Develop and own new tools and improve existing tools used to create and test OpenInvests investment methodologies.
 Lead and conduct data analysis to inform business decisions and/or product design. Be able to initiate data analysis ideas and execute with precision and efficiency.
 Lead and contribute to projects within the OpenInvest Investment Research team, collaborating closely with other team members.
 Manage, develop, and. educate a small team and create a cohesive and efficient working environment.
 Collaborate and act as the lead / key point of contact cross-functionally with OpenInvests engineering, product, and research teams to identify areas where data analysis can be conducted effectively.
 Own research testing requirements and anticipated testing needs, including identifying testing pain-points and collaborating with team members to generate the best solutions.
 Cultivate a strong, trustful relationship with OpenInvests research, cross functional, and JP Morgan data and testing stakeholders while managing release, rollout, and deployment of data-related products and platforms.

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills:
 7-10 years of experience in one or more of the following disciplines: Analytics or Data insights-related role, Statistics, Quantitative Finance, Data Science or Engineering.
 Intermediate to Advance programming skills in Python and SQL along with knowledge off BI tools like PowerBI, Tableau or Qlik
 Experienced at building/owning tooling, managing big data, and extracting valuable insights.
 Background / familiarity with Sustainable Investing/ESG themes, regulatory requirements, and trends
 Experience working with, analyzing, executing, and presenting test scripts and cases.
 Analytical experience, with a focus on statistical analysis, financial modelling or other data related analysis, and strong proficiency in Microsoft office
 Able to seamlessly switch between research, development, and product management.

Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills:
 Experience with data science techniques
 Ability to articulate quantitative analysis and complex technical topics to non-technical stakeholders.
 Familiarity with sustainability-related regulatory requirements and related technical implementation efforts,

ABOUT INTELLECT DESIGN ARENA LTD:

Intellect Design Arena Limited is a global leader in Financial Technology for Banking, Insurance, and other Financial Services. With a rich suite of products across the organization, backed with over 30 years of deep domain expertise, we are an authority on vertical and integrated products that enable institutions to meet their ambition to be the principal service provider to their customers. Our commitment is to take banking into the future, anticipating and solving the needs of tomorrows businesses.

WHAT WE DO:

We create financial technologies that help banks lead businesses on the path to growth and success. Our solutions help move the banking world forward; because thats what happens when the world knows it has financial institutions they can rely on. This is the philosophy that we at Intellect follow and our commitment to our customers. success.

A uniquely focused Products business, over $200 million Intellect Design Arena group has the soul of an agile start-up, with the maturity of an established specialist in designing advanced technology products for global financial platforms across Global Transaction Banking (GTB), Global Consumer Banking (GCB), Risk, Treasury & Markets (RTM), Insurance (Intellect SEEC) and e-Governance (GeM).

OUR ACHIEVEMENTS:

We are the world's No.1 Fintech company recognized by the global survey of IBS. We provide full spectrum, fully integrated products that run in over 250 financial institutions, across 90+ countries. With over 4500 solution architects, and domain and technology specialists, backed with over 30 years of deep domain expertise, Intellect is the brand on which progressive financial institutions rely on for transformation initiatives.

Our aggressively customer-centric design philosophy has enabled the engineering of agile and holistic digital solutions, with full lifecycle enablement and industry-leading performance assurances.

Explore more about us at: www.intellectdesign.com

WHAT INTELLECT OFFERS YOU:

FT 8012, the Worlds First FinTech Design Center for Financial Institutions, Has a rich and truly diverse work environment that is bustling with creative energy and individual perspectives from 29 nationalities and 30 languages.

LIVE YOUR DREAM - Intellect is India's most profitable unicorn. A pioneer in design thinking, it has helped shape the future of fintech with passion, and cutting-edge products.

 Explore new possibilities at the epi-center of Design Thinking and cutting-edge technology
 Unleash your true potential with mentor-led growth and development

 A diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where teammates are empowered to bring ideas to the table and act.
 Influencing
 We are agenda setters in the market by delivering composable, contextual, and hyper-scalable Fintech solutions.

job details:
Vandey provides outsourced instructional services to institutions of higher education and is seeking a candidate to work for Vandey to serve in a full-time role as a Senior Data Analyst  Marketing Operations with the University of the People.

University of the People (UoPeople) [https://www.uopeople.edu/] is the first non-profit, tuition-free, American, accredited, 100% online university. Today, UoPeople has over 137,000 students enrolled from more than 200 countries and territories, including 16,500 students who are refugees. Currently accredited by the DEAC, UoPeople is also a candidate for WSCUC accreditation.

We believe that higher education is a basic human right and that it can transform not only the lives of students, but also their families" lives, their communities, their nations, and, by extension, the world. See President Reshefs TED talk when he announced the founding of the University. https://www.ted.com/talks/shai_reshef_an_ultra_low_cost_college_degree language=en

UoPeople is an innovative university, and we welcome team members who bring creativity and innovation to their roles. Were a fast-paced organization with remote teams all around the globe. If youre a self-starter who wants to succeed alongside a passionate team, wed love to hear from you!

About the Role

As a Senior Data Analyst at the University of the People, you will have a significant opportunity to impact and drive the organization to new heights. You will be a data science leader, bridging the gap between data and marketing strategy. You'll leverage your expertise in statistical analysis, data visualization, and data storytelling to develop and implement analysis-driven solutions that optimize the user journey and marketing campaigns. In this hybrid role, you will both manage a small team of marketing data analysts and contribute hands-on with advanced data analysis, overseeing the universitys marketing data infrastructure, and building dashboards.

Primary Responsibilities:

Data Analysis and Insights:
 Create, develop, and maintain dashboards using tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Looker to track funnel, campaigns, and product performance.
 Analyze, process, and present data across the customer journey to provide actionable insights for optimizing marketing efforts.
 Conduct in-depth analyses and A/B testing using advanced statistical methodologies to understand user behavior and market trends.
 Own the responsibility for tracking all major KPIs, metrics, and attribution for the Marketing Operations department.

Data and Marketing Strategy:
 Advise Enrollment department leadership on implementing data-driven marketing strategies.
 Utilize advanced analytical techniques to identify patterns, predict user behavior, and personalize marketing experiences.
 Deliver persuasive presentations to stakeholders, translating complex data into actionable insights and strategic recommendations
 Champion a data-driven culture within the marketing department by fostering an environment of continuous learning and experimentation.

Data Leadership and Management:
 Oversee the construction and maintenance of the Google Big Query marketing database
 Lead and develop a small but growing team of marketing data analysts, fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented environment.
 Serve as the primary data authority for all marketing initiatives, ensuring data accuracy, relevancy, and accessibility for the team.

Requirements:
 At least a bachelors degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, or other discipline emphasizing statistical and analytical skills
 8+ years of experience in marketing data science and analytics field.
 5+ years working with data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, etc.).
 Proven experience working with marketing databases (Google Big Query) and ETL processes.
 Demonstrated expert-level proficiency in SQL and advanced quantitative analysis techniques and languages (Python preferred)
 High-level proficiency with Google Analytics 4
 Independent, dedicated, and action-oriented with a proactive approach to problem-solving.
 Ability to excel in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English,
skills: Statistical Analysis,Data Visualization,Tableau,Power BI,SQL,Python,Google Analytics,Data Storytelling,Looker,AB Testing
